What is ZenIcons

ZenIcons is an open-source icon set crafted for web, iOS, Android, and desktop apps. Built from scratch as a Framework, ZenIcons is easy to use and apply in any of your projects. With fully compatibility with most browsers, responsive design and lightweight capabilities, it is the ideal solution for the most common web ideas you could think of.

Usage

ZenIcons Framework allows you to easily insert any of the icons in your web with a few lines of code. It does not matter if you are using them for personal projects or business applications, just inserting a CSS line in the header will do all the magic. After that, is up to you what icons you want to use.

Let's start!

Now that you get the idea behind the ZenIcons Framework; why you just give it a try?
Here you will find all the instructions to start using it in no time

Getting Started

Downloading and Installing

You can download the latest version of ZenIcons from here. After downloading it, place it next to the project where you want to use it.

After that, put the following line of code between the <head></head> tags: 

<link id="ZendIcons" rel="stylesheet" href="src/1.0/css/styles.css" />

With just that line, you are ready to use all the icons in ZenIcons. Easy-peasy! right?

Basic Use of the Font

Now you are ready to use any icon you want in your code. Just select one of our icons and add it to your code. You can click on the icon and copy the code or use your own.

<i class="zi-copy"></i>

This will display the following result

But it won't work only with the "i" tag. You can use other tags, for example:

<span class="zi-folder-download"></span>

This will display the following result

And you can combine these icons with text without any trouble.

<span class="zi-home"></span> Home

This will display the following result

Home

Or you can use them in lists or menus 

<ul>
    <li><span class="zi-home"></span> Home</li>
    <li><span class="zi-book"></span> Books</li>
    <li><span class="zi-tags"></span> Categories</li>
</ul>
  • Home
  • Books
  • Categories

Sizing

As any other font, you can use your CSS skills to modify the size of the icons; or you can use some special classes that ZenIcons provides to take care of this using our Framework.

 <div class="text-center">
    <span class="zi-home"></span> zi-home
</div>
<div class="text-center">
    <span class="zi-home zif-2x"></span> zi-home zif-2x
</div>
<div class="text-center">
    <span class="zi-home zif-3x"></span> zi-home zif-3x
</div>
<div class="text-center">
    <span class="zi-home zif-4x"></span> zi-home zif-4x
</div>
zi-home
zi-home zif-2x
zi-home zif-3x
zi-home zif-4x

Spinning
